body: Based on experiences on Voat, many smaller image hosts that pop up end up going dead after a few months leaving many older posts with dead links which isn't great. In theory, its good to have alternatives to imgur. In practice, there are already a number of alternatives but keeping them up is another matter. I'm not sure another would really help that.

In theory, its good to have alternatives to imgur. In practice, there are already a number of alternatives but keeping them up is another matter. I'm not sure another would really help that.

post.title: Do a lot of y'all want a better alternative to imgur?

body: I use and recommend pic8.co. It keeps a copy of the image and uploads it to new image hosts as and when previous image hosts take the image down or themselves go down. In short, it's the most resilient solution you'll find short of something on a blockchain.
body_html: I use and recommend pic8.co. It keeps a copy of the image and uploads it to new image hosts as and when previous image hosts take the image down or themselves go down. In short, it's the most resilient solution you'll find short of something on a blockchain.

Yes please.

Dont put a ui, make it as barebones as possible and you should automatically backup each photo to the internet archive (web.archive.org) so if it does go offline, then it'll redirect the url to there. Because I always see dead links everywhere on older forums.

body: Are you sure you have installed an userscript extension? [Violentmonkey](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/violentmonkey/jinjaccalgkegednnccohejagnlnfdag) works well. Other monkeys (Greasemonkey, Tampermonkey) worked with older RuqES versions, there's a good chance they still work.
